channel.title: Projects on Yale Undergraduate Quantum Computing
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Yale Undergraduate Quantum Computing

item.title: Project Ideas
item.description: Projects: efforts ranging open-source packages to hackathon events to resource development and more! SUBMIT YOUR PROJECT IDEAS: Have an idea for a project? Click here to propose a project! NOTE: Each project requires a corresponding project proposal that can be filled out and submitted later. Click here for the template for the write-up. Get involved with a current project: Want to see what we’re working on? Click here to check out our project spreadsheet.

item.title: Qiskit Surface Code Encoder and MWPM Decoder
item.description: About We are building a Surface Code Encoder and Minimum Weight Perfect Matching Decoder package for Qiskit Ignis. Here is the Github repo: https://github.com/Phionx/qiskit_surface_codes Here is a link to our project proposal. Status This open-source package was presented at the November 2020 Qiskit Advocate Demo Session and is pending official incorporating into Qiskit Ignis. Our immediate goal is to demonstrate the rotated surface code threshold point in simulation. Team The first iteration of this project was created by members Shantanu Jha ‘21, Henry Liu ‘21 and Will Sun ‘22 for IBM Qiskit Ignis.

item.title: Qubit by Qubit Initiative
item.description: Apply for paid and volunteer opportunities at the Qubit by Qubit Initiative. Here are some of their current projects: Developing homework, problem sets, or worksheets Developing middle or high school curricula for quantum Developing or editing content for textbook for high school students Developing quantum workshop for K-12 students Being a Teaching Assistant for intro course Teaching quantum workshops to K-12 students Please reach out to member Shoumik Chowdhury ‘21 to learn more!
